page.title: 15LITTLE STOKE VILLAGE
page.content: The village of Little Stoke is situated on the B 5027 which branches off the A 51. The first thing to be seen is a scrap yard reclaiming metal products. The village possesses a public house namely the Three Crowns. Next to this is a Victorian postbox with 'VR' on. Near the level crossing is the old Aston-by-Stone station. Recently the village is being increasingly 'swallowed' up by development around Stone. Fradley Homes have been developing 'high class' houses on an estate near Blackies Lane. Opposite this new building is Little Stoke Cricket Club. This was founded in 1946.
